doc.ContractDescription: ACCRETING NEUTRON STARS IN LOW-MASS X-RAY BINARY SYSTEMS NS LMXBS SHOW A WIDE RANGE OF SPECTRAL PROPERTIES AND MANY TYPES OF RAPID FLUX VARIABILITY IN THE X-RAY BAND. BASED ON HOW THESE SPECTRAL AND TIMING PROPERTIES CORRELATE, THREE MAIN SUBCLASSES OF THE PERSISTENTLY BRIGHT NS-LMXBS HAVE BEEN RECOGNIZED: THE ATOLL, SOURCES, THE SCO-LIKE Z SOURCES, AND THE CYG-LIKE Z SOURCES. WHILE IT HAD LONG BEEN CLEAR THAT THE Z SOURCES ARE CONSIDERABLY MORE LUMINOUS THAN THE ATOLL SOURCES, AND HENCE ACCRETE AT MUCH HIGHER MASS ACCRETION RATES, THE RELATIVE LUMINOSITIES OF THE TWO Z SOURCE SUBCLASSES WERE NOT KNOWN. MOREOVER, THE NATURE OF THE SPECTRAL EVOLUTION ALONG THE TRACKS TRACED OUT BY Z SOURCES REMAINS A MYSTERY. PART OF THE PROBLEM WITH PAST ATTEMPTS TO MODEL THE Z SOURCE SPECTRA IS THE FACT THAT THE BROAD ENERGY COVERAGE OF THESE MISSIONS WAS PROVIDED BY TWO OR THREE DIFFERENT INSTRUMENTS, INSTEAD OF A SINGLE ONE. AS A RESULT OF THIS, THE INTERPRETATION OF THESE SPECTRA SUFFERED FROM CALIBRATION UNCERTAINTIES BETWEEN THE VARIOUS INSTRUMENTS. IN PRACTICE THIS LED TO POOR CONSTRAINTS IN THE HIGH ENERGY COMPONENTS IN THE SPECTRA. NUSTAR FOR THE FIRST TIME PROVIDES BROAD ENERGY COVERAGE FROM SINGLE INSTRUMENT (OR, TO BE PRECISE TWO NEARLY IDENTICAL DETECTORS), THEREBY REMOVING AN IMPORTANT SOURCE OF UNCERTAINTY IN THE MODELING OF NS-LMXB SPECTRA. ADDITIONALLY, NUSTAR IS MUCH MORE SENSITIVE THAN THE AFOREMENTIONED SATELLITES AT HIGH ENERGIES. WE PROPOSE THREE SHORT (25 KS) OBSERVATIONS OF THE CYG-LIKE Z SOURCE GX 5-1 WITH THE AIM OF BETTER UNDERSTANDING THE SUPER-EDDINGTON ACCRETION FLOWS ONTO NEUTRON STARS. THE GOAL OF OUR OBSERVATIONS IS TO TEST PROPOSED MODELS FOR THE SPECTRAL EVOLUTION IN THIS TYPE OF SOURCE, BY SIMULTANEOUSLY CONSTRAINING THE CONTINUUM AND REFLECTION FEATURES (IN PARTICULAR THE FE LINE) IN THE SPECTRUM. NUSTAR IS UNIQUELY CAPABLE OF DOING SO. BY OBSERVING GX 5-1 WE COMPLETE NUSTAR'S COVERAGE OF NEUTRON-STAR LOW-MASS X-RAY BINARIES ACROSS THE ENTIRE LUMINOSITY RANGE OF THIS CLASS, ALLOWING FOR A DETAILED COMPARISON BETWEEN SUBCLASSES. DATA WILL BE ANALYZED WITH THE STANDARD NUSTAR FTOOLS. OUR ANALYSIS WILL START WITH THE CREATION OF A HARDNESS-INTENSITY DIAGRAM (IN WHICH THE BRANCHES ARE BETTER SEPARATED THAN IN A COLOR-COLOR DIAGRAM). THIS WILL SERVE AS THE FOUNDATION FOR OUR SPECTRAL EXTRACTION. SPECTRA WILL THEN BE EXTRACTED FROM DIFFERENT POSITION ALONG THE Z TRACK AND THESE SPECTRA WILL BE ANALYZED USING VARIOUS SPECTRAL MODELS. THE RESEARCH OUTLINED IN THIS PROPOSAL ADDRESSES NASA'S 2014 STRATEGIC GOALS OBJECTVIE 1.6 DISCOVER HOW THE UNIVERSE WORKS, EXPLORE HOW IT BEGAN AND EVOLVED, AND SEARCH FOR LIFE ON PLANETS AROUND OTHER STARS.
doc.MajorAgency: THE SUPER-EDDINGTON ACCRETION FLOW IN GX 5-1
doc.MajorFundingAgency: THE SUPER-EDDINGTON ACCRETION FLOW IN GX 5-1
doc.ProductorServiceCode: AR21: R&D- SPACE: SCIENCE/APPLICATIONS (BASIC RESEARCH)

doc.ContractDescription: AWARD: CONSTRUCTION SECTOR ANALYSIS, TECHNICAL AND FACILITATION SUPPORT ADD DCN NUMBER. THE PURPOSE OF THIS ADMINISTRATIVE MODIFICATION IS TO: 1. DOCUMENT A FUNDS SWEEP AND TO CORRECT THE CORRESPONDING OBLIGATION AMOUNT FOR THIS TASK ORDER (TO) IN THE FEDERAL PROCUREMENT DATA SYSTEM (FPDS). THE FUNDS SWEEP DEOBLIGATED FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $86.34 FROM THIS TO, BUT DID IT IN THE FINANCIAL SYSTEM ONLY WITHOUT AN OFFICIAL MODIFICATION (WHICH REPORTS TO FPDS), LEAVING THE FUNDING AMOUNT IN THE FINANCIAL SYSTEM AND THE OBLIGATION AMOUNT IN FPDS OUT OF SYNC. ON 21 DECEMBER 2010, WHEN THE DATA ASSOCIATED WITH THIS TO WAS MIGRATED FROM OUR OLD CONTRACT WRITING SYSTEM, INTEGRATED CONTRACTS MANAGEMENT SYSTEM (ICMS), TO OUR NEW CONTRACT WRITING SYSTEM, EPA ACQUISITION SYSTEM (EAS), IT PULLED THE FUNDING AMOUNT FROM THE FINANCIAL SYSTEM, AND NOT FROM FPDS, DUE TO COMMONALITY OF FUNDING SWEEPS AT EPA. TO CORRECT FOR THIS ERROR, THIS MODIFICATION DOCUMENTS THE FUNDING SWEEP DONE TO THIS ORDER IN THE AMOUNT OF $86.34; BELOW IS A DETAILED COST AND FEE BREAKDOWN SHOWING THE DEOBLIGATED FUNDS DUE TO THE FUNDS SWEEP: COST CEILING: $ 42,542.00 FEE CEILING: $2,846.00 TOTAL CPFF: $ 45,388.00 FUNDED COST: $ 42,542.00 - ($86.34) = $42,455.66 FUNDED FEE: $2,846.00 TOTAL CPFF: $ 45,301.66 2. THEN INCREASE AN EXPIRED LINE OF ACCOUNTING (DCN: 07E1D7R003) BY $86.34 TO PAY FOR COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH THE INDIRECT RATE ADJUSTMENT DATED 24 JANUARY 2013; BELOW IS A DETAILED COST AND FEE BREAKDOWN SHOWING THE OBLIGATION OF $86.34 BACK TO THE TASK ORDER*: COST CEILING: $42,542.00 FEE CEILING: $2,846.00 TOTAL CPFF: $45,388.00 FUNDED COST: $42,455.66 + ($86.34) = $42,542.00 FUNDED FEE: $2,846.00 TOTAL CPFF: $45,388.00 3. UPDATE THE RTP-FINANCE OFFICE ADDRESS TO: RTP FINANCE CENTER US ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY RTP-FINANCE CENTER (AA216-01) 109 TW ALEXANDER DRIVE WWW2.EPA.GOV/FINANCIAL/CONTRACTS DURHAM NC 27711 *THIS IS THE MOST CURRENT DEPICTION OF THE TASK ORDER CEILINGS AND OBLIGATED FUNDING.
doc.ProductorServiceCode: R408: SUPPORT- PROFESSIONAL: PROGRAM MANAGEMENT/SUPPORT
